com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices

Class WOWZCameraView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WOWZCameraView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, WOWZBroadcastAPI.AdaptiveBroadcaster, WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster, WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster

    public class WOWZCameraView
extends android.view.SurfaceView
implements WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster, WOWZBroadcastAPI.AdaptiveBroadcaster, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, android.content.ComponentCallbacks
    The WOWZCameraView class is a custom class for previewing the video captured from a camera.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  WOWZCameraView.PreviewStatusListener
      Callback interface to use with setPreviewStatusListener(PreviewStatusListener).

      WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster getBroadcaster()
      Deprecated. 
      The WOWZCameraView class now implements the WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster interface so you can use a WOWZCameraView instance directly in WOWZBroadcastConfig.setVideoBroadcaster(WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster), for example, broadcastConfig.setVideoBroadcaster(cameraView);.

      Called from the activity's onPause() method to store the state of the camera preview display before the application is sent to the background.
      void onResume()
      Use in conjunction with onPause() when called from the activity's onResume() method to restart the camera preview display based on the state it was in when the activity was paused and a corresponding call to onPause() was made.

        Checks whether the camera preview display is active. Equivalent to getPreviewStatus().isRunning() and getPreviewStatus().getState == WOWZState.RUNNING

        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Initializes each component of a broadcast. Upon successful initialization, each component must set its status to WOWZState.READY or WOWZState.IDLE and also indicate the error in the status.

      • startBroadcasting

        public com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.status.WOWZStatus startBroadcasting()
        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Called on each broadcast component to begin a live streaming broadcast. Upon success, each component must set its status to WOWZState.RUNNING or WOWZState.IDLE and also indicate the error in the status.
        Specified by:
        startBroadcasting in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The status after transitioning each broadcast component to WOWZState.RUNNING.

      • stopBroadcasting

        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster

        Specified by:
        stopBroadcasting in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The status after transitioning each broadcast component to WOWZState.IDLE.

        Returns:

      • getActiveFrameSize

        public WOWZSize getActiveFrameSize()
        Gets the active video frame size, which may differ from the requested frame size if the current scale mode is FILL_VIEW.
        Returns:
        The active video frame size.

      • setFrameSize

        public WOWZSize setFrameSize(int width,
                             int height)
        Updates the frame size for the active camera with the specified values. The actual frame size resulting from this operation may differ from the specified frame size. If the active camera device doesn't support the specified frame size, the closest, larger frame size that is supported will be used instead and indicated as the return value from this method.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the video frame size, in pixels.
        height - The height of the video frame size, in pixels.
        Returns:
        The actual frame size used, which may differ from the specified frame size depending on device support.

      • setFrameSize

        public WOWZSize setFrameSize(WOWZSize frameSize)
        Updates the frame size for the active camera with the specified size. The actual frame size resulting from this operation may differ from the specified frame size. If the active camera device doesn't support the specified frame size, the closest, larger frame size that is supported will be used instead and indicated as the return value from this method.

        Parameters:
        frameSize - The frame size specification.
        Returns:
        The actual frame size used, which may differ from the specified frame size depending on device support.

      • getFramerate

        public int getFramerate()
        Gets the currently configured video frame rate.
        Returns:
        The current frame rate.

      • setFramerate

        public int setFramerate(int framerate)
        Updates the frame rate for the active camera with the specified value. The actual frame rate resulting from this call may differ from the specified frame rate. If the active camera device doesn't support the specified frame rate, the closest supported frame rate will be used instead and indicated as the return value from this method.

        Parameters:
        framerate - The requested frame rate, in fps.
        Returns:
        The actual frame rate, which may differ from the specified value depending on device support.

      • switchCamera

        public WOWZCamera switchCamera()
        Changes the active camera being previewed to the alternate device camera, if available. In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the alternate camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable(WOWZSize withFrameSize)
        Checks whether the current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence. In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.
        Parameters:
        withFrameSize - If supplied, the result will only be true if the other camera supports the specified frame size.
        Returns:
        True if the active camera can be switched; false otherwise.

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable(WOWZMediaConfig mediaConfig)
        Checks whether the current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence. In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the frane size of the currently active camera.
        Parameters:
        mediaConfig - If supplied, the result will only be true if the other camera supports the video frame size indicated by the specified configration.
        Returns:
        True if the active camera can be switched; false otherwise.

      • isSwitchCameraAvailable

        public boolean isSwitchCameraAvailable()
        Checks whether the current camera can be switched based on the state of any live streaming broadcast currently active and device presence. In order to switch the active camera while streaming, the other camera must support the video frame size of the currently active camera.
        Returns:
        True if the active camera can be switched; false otherwise.

      • surfaceCreated

        public void surfaceCreated(android.view.SurfaceHolder surfaceHolder)
        Called immediately after the surface is first created. Implementations of this should start up whatever rendering code they desire. Only one thread can ever draw into a Surface, so you should not draw into the Surface here if your normal rendering will be in another thread.
        Specified by:
        surfaceCreated in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        surfaceHolder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being created.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder,
                           int format,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Called immediately after any structural changes (format or size) have been made to the surface. You should at this point update the imagery in the surface. This method is always called at least once, after surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder).
        Specified by:
        surfaceChanged in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        holder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface has changed.

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public void surfaceDestroyed(android.view.SurfaceHolder holder)
        Called immediately before a surface is being destroyed. After returning from this call, you should no longer try to access this surface. If you have a rendering thread that directly accesses the surface, you must ensure that thread is no longer touching the Surface before returning from this function.
        Specified by:
        surfaceDestroyed in interface android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
        Parameters:
        holder - The SurfaceHolder whose surface is being destroyed.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called from the activity's onPause() method to store the state of the camera preview display before the application is sent to the background. The stored state can then be restored with a corresponding call to onResume() made from the activity's onResume() method.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Use in conjunction with onPause() when called from the activity's onResume() method to restart the camera preview display based on the state it was in when the activity was paused and a corresponding call to onPause() was made.

      • getScreenSize

        public WOWZSize getScreenSize()
        Gets the size of camera preview display.
        Returns:
        The size of camera preview display, in pixels.
